article.headline: Loyola Marymount 81, Santa Clara 70
article.story: LOS ANGELES -- Ashley Hamilton scored 15 points and had 10 rebounds and Jared DuBois added 17 points as Loyola Marymount defeated Santa Clara 81-70 Saturday night. The Lions (10-9, 1-2 West Coast Conference) build a 21-point lead in the first half and nearly let it get away as the Broncos pulled to within three in the second half. Marc Trasolini led Santa Clara (8-13, 0-4) with 17 points and Michael Santos added 14 points. Loyola Marymount hit eight of its first nine shots and jumped out to a 25-4 lead with 13:07 left before halftime. The Broncos cut the deficit to 45-32 at intermission and after a 10-5 run were within 56-53 with 9:56 to play. The Lions then responded with a 7-2 run, and Santa Clara didn't threaten again. Vernon Teel also had a double-double for Loyola Marymount, finishing with 10 points and 10 rebounds.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
